explanation: num_resps — the second-clause expression of the for loop (i < num_resps). You must confirm that num_resps is not modified by the loop body or by any function the body calls. resps — the array object written in the loop body (resps[i]). Include it to check whether any called function modifies resps (or the resps pointer) which would violate the requirement that the second clause not depend on objects modified in the loop body. i — the loop counter variable in the first and third clauses; include it to verify no function called in the body has side-effects on i (the third clause may only modify the loop counter). create_response_object — the function invoked inside the loop body; its behaviour (side-effects) must be examined to ensure it does not modify the loop counter (i), num_resps, or any other object used in the loop clause(s). MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static and MHD_create_response_empty — direct callees of create_response_object; include them because the behaviour of functions called within the loop body is part of the loop body behaviour per the MISRA rule, so any side-effects in these functions that modify i, num_resps, resps, or other objects used in the for clauses must be ruled out.
